content: सूक्ष्म {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [सूच्-मन् सुक् च नेट्; <ls>Uṇ. 4. 176</ls>] {@--1@} Subtle, minute, atomic; जालांतरस्थसूर्यांशौ यत्सूक्ष्मं ट्टश्यते रजः. {@--2@} Little, small; इदमुपहितसूक्ष्मग्रंथिना स्कंधदेशे <ls>Ś. 1. 19</ls>; <ls>R. 18. 49.</ls> {@--3@} Fine, thin, delicate, exquisite. {@--4@} Nice. {@--5@} Sharp, acute, penetrating. {@--6@} Crafty, artful, subtle, ingenious. {@--7@} Exact, precise, accurate, correct. --क्ष्मः {@--1@} An atom. {@--2@} The clearing-nut plant. {@--3@} An epithet of Śiva. --क्ष्मं {@--1@} The subtle all-pervading spirit, the Supreme Soul. {@--2@} Minuteness. {@--3@} One of the three kinds of power attainable by an ascetic; <ab>cf.</ab> सावद्य. {@--4@} Craft, ingenuity. {@--5@} Fraud, cheating. {@--6@} Fine thread &c. {@--7@} <ab>N.</ab> of a figure of speech, thus defined by Mammaṭa: --कुतोऽपि लक्षितः सूक्ष्मोप्यर्थोन्यस्मै प्रकाश्यते . धर्मेण केनचिद्यत्र तत्सूक्ष्मं परिचक्षते <ls>K. P. 10.</ls>
